ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to sing and harmonize with a huge ensemble.
Early music performance
Through this course, I was able to engage with music again. The class was taught music from the Elizabethan era and learned so much of Early Music Theory.
Sight-reading and orchestral direction.
I learned so much about things I had never been exposed to before! You learn about early instruments, early notation, temperaments, theory, composers, technique--it's an amazing course.
Chamber music playing, baroque music repertoire and style
A good working knowledge of early music and techniques of performing it
I grew to understand music on a deeper level, although I have been studying it for many years. Every performance and practice was a valuable learning experience.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I hope there could be more opportunities for students to learn how to conduct.
The class is fantastic as we meet for rehearsals and put on two concerts in the Beinecke Library!
It's a great course for intermediate vocalists.
It's perfect!
Great course!
The course is just a really great way to engage with the performance of pre-1700 music. I dont really think there are any weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Extremely knowledgeable professor and great music!
Yes, very fun if you like early music
Absolutely! This course was a great music course for those who are hoping to get more experience in playing and performing.
Yes! It's the best!
Yes! You will learn a great deal in a low-pressure environment and get to perform at the Beinecke! It's a class unlike any other you will take at Yale.
Great opportunity to play with other musicians and learn rep from a non-standard time period.

If you were interested in music, and like the sound of polyphony, I would highly recommend this course. It is a great way to get involved in a group and work with people who are committed to the rehearsal and performance of this rare art form.

I would recommend this course to a student who may already have a music background but is not necessarily studying music as a major. I feel that the course provides a new perspective of music through being able to listen, play, and learn about different instruments and music that are not common today.

extras.title: MUSI 240 01 - The Performance of Early Music
